title: Reorder and top-align landing page hero supporting copy

requirements.summary: Move the hero supporting paragraph to the top of the Home page hero content and adjust layout spacing so it sits as high as practical while preserving readability, overlays/gradients, and existing CTAs/routes.
acceptanceCriteria: In the Home page hero, the supporting paragraph starting with “Create your own AI-powered web app in minutes. No coding required.” appears above the “AI-Powered App Builder” label (and above the CTA buttons).
The hero content layout is adjusted (e.g., padding/margins/vertical alignment) so this paragraph is positioned at the top of the hero content area rather than centered, especially on mobile.
The existing hero overlay/gradients remain in place and the paragraph remains readable over the background image in both light and dark themes.
No user-facing copy in that paragraph is changed (English text remains exactly as currently shown).
The CTA buttons and their routes remain unchanged and continue to render correctly across responsive breakpoints.

file_operations.description: In the hero section, reorder the hero content so the supporting paragraph (beginning with “Create your own AI-powered web app in minutes. No coding required.”) renders first, above the “AI-Powered App Builder” label and above the CTA buttons. Update hero container/section layout classes to top-align the hero content within the hero area (e.g., adjust flex alignment and top padding/margins) with responsive spacing so it sits as high as practical on mobile and desktop while remaining readable and visually balanced. Preserve existing overlay/gradient layers and keep CTA buttons and navigation behavior unchanged.
